name: Burrowing Owl
overview: Brooding is a time where these owls are preparing food for their hatchlings. During the time of Brooding, these owls begin to store a surplus of food so there is enough food for their chicks. they are unlike many other owls where they are active at night, instead they go out and hunt their prey During the day. they communicate using chattering call and when surprised or exited they have the tendency of a jerking movement. Females stay with their young for the most part while the males bring the food.
habitat: They like to live in the grasslands where they steal burrows from other small rodents. During the summer the owls migrate to living in between the west and east cost of the United States. During winter they migrate to Mexico and the Nothern parts of South America.
tags: athene cunicularia burrowing owl small brown white yellow bird animal birds
